S001.body: Emma crushed the practice SAT section today! She scored 680/800 - huge improvement from last month. Recommended resources: https://khanacademy.org/sat for extra practice. College Board also has free practice tests: https://collegeboard.org/sat/practice
Physics concepts are clicking! Need to work on free body diagrams a bit more. @Sarah - are you covering vectors in your math sessions? Would help reinforce what we're doing in physics.
Parent wants weekly updates via email (jennifer.w@email.com). Will send progress reports every Friday. Also FYI - Science Olympiad competition is Nov 12, so Emma might need to reschedule that week.

S002.body: James is making excellent progress with reading comp! Recommend keeping sessions at 1 hour max due to focus challenges. Using audiobooks as supplement - check out his favorites: https://audible.com/pd/The-Giver
His creative writing is phenomenal - submitted piece to school lit magazine. Check out his blog: https://jameswritesstories.com. Thinking about having him enter a national writing contest.
@Michael - heads up that James might need your help with an English essay this week. His mom (carlos.m@email.com) mentioned it when I saw her. Due date is Oct 30.

S003.body: Sophia is ready for the AP Calc exam! Her understanding of series convergence is college-level. Recommend supplemental practice: https://apcentral.collegeboard.org/courses/ap-calculus-bc. Also working through MIT OpenCourseWare problems.
Chemistry midterm coming up Nov 15. Will schedule extra session week before. Also helping her prepare for MIT interview next month! Alum interviewer contact: alum@mit.edu
Reminder: Sophia needs recommendation letter by Nov 10 for Berkeley early action. @Emily - are you writing one too? Parent wants to review draft: priya.patel@email.com

S004.body: Liam is improving with consistency! Keep sessions to 1 hour max before basketball. Using sports stats to make math more engaging - calculated shooting percentages today and he loved it. Check out this tool: https://stats.nba.com for real examples.
Book report is coming along nicely. Due Nov 5. Will have him email draft to me by Nov 3. Contact: liam.thompson@student.edu. Also working on citation format - MLA style.
@Michael - Liam mentioned he's struggling with vocab homework. Can you reinforce context clues in your next session? His teacher also recommended Quizlet: https://quizlet.com/subject/vocabulary

S005.body: College essay is really strong - reviewing final draft today. Yale early decision deadline is Nov 1, so we're cutting it close! Common App portal: https://commonapp.org. Parents want daily updates this week: jennifer.kim@email.com
@Michael - can you review her personal statement from a humanities perspective? I'm helping with the "why Yale" supplement. She's also applying to Harvard and Princeton - essays due Nov 1.
Interview prep went well. Mock interview scheduled for Oct 30 with Yale alum. Reminded her to prepare questions about residential colleges. Resources: https://admissions.yale.edu/interview-faqs

S006.body: Noah's English is improving rapidly! Working on academic vocabulary for standardized tests. Mom prefers updates in Spanish - contact: maria.garcia@email.com. Using Duolingo for supplemental practice: https://duolingo.com

Math is definitely his strength! Scored 95% on last test. Using gaming contexts to teach - calculated damage-per-second in his favorite game today and he was fully engaged. Might recommend accelerated math track.
@Sarah - Noah mentioned he wants to learn game design. Any chance you could incorporate some basic programming concepts in math? Scratch might be perfect: https://scratch.mit.edu

S007.body: Ava's art history essay is excellent - really insightful analysis of Renaissance techniques. Piano recital is Nov 15, so schedule will be tight next two weeks. Check her competition schedule: https://mtac.org/events

Biology is challenging for her but we're making progress. Using visual diagrams and art analogies to explain cell structure. @Michael - any creative writing assignments that could incorporate science concepts?
College application timeline: Juilliard pre-screening due Dec 1. Working on personal statement about how music informs her artistic vision. Parent wants weekly check-ins: robert.brown@email.com
